definition: Snow (name)/Edgar Snow (1905-1972), American journalist, reported from China 1928-1941, author of Red Star Over China
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

pinyin: ke4 la1 si1 nuo4 da2 er3
Ke4 la1 si1 nuo4 ya4 er3 si1 ke4

definition: Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
Edgar Snow (1905-1972), American journalist, reported from China 1928-1941, author of Red Star Over China

sentences.english: Tabb is the first woman to referee a world snooker championship final.
sentences.chinese: 塔普是第一位在斯诺克世锦赛决赛中担当裁判的女性。

sentences.english: My first interest in snooker occurred when I was seven years old.
sentences.chinese: 我最初对斯诺克产生兴趣是在七岁的时候。

sentences.english: Schnoor said prices soared threefold in early 2008.
sentences.chinese: 斯诺说，在2008年早期，价格飙升至原来三倍。
那小子就是我的斯诺登。

sentences.english: In the course of our research, we spoke with a number of professional snooker and billiards players.
sentences.chinese: 我们在研究中和几位职业斯诺克和台球运动员谈话。

sentences.english: Snowball and Napoleon were by far the most active in the debates.
sentences.chinese: 斯诺鲍和拿破仑是讨论中最活跃的。
斯诺登山是一座很高的山。

sentences.english: I spent a hour playing snooker with my schoolmate in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 中午在老校和同学打了一个小时的斯诺克。

sentences.english: How can their denial be reconciled with Snowden's allegations?
sentences.chinese: 他们的否定要如何跟斯诺登的指控调和？

sentences.english: What were your highlights of the 2010 Betfred. com World Snooker Championship?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得2010年世界斯诺克锦标赛的亮点是什么？

sentences.english: Feinstein said Snowden should have stayed in the United States and faced consequences for his actions.
sentences.chinese: 范士丹说斯诺登应该呆在美国，面对其行为后果。

sentences.english: Snowden gets vindicated every time the US and UK does something like this.
sentences.chinese: 每次有人维护斯诺登，美英就会做些什么。

sentences.english: Snowden also feels he will not receive a fair trial, Patino says.
sentences.chinese: 斯诺登也觉得他不会受到公正的审判，帕蒂诺说。

sentences.english: Snowdon and the mountains beyond were covered in snow.
sentences.chinese: 斯诺顿和远处的山到处都是白雪皑皑。

sentences.english: We must not rush this train out of the station,’’ Ms. Snowe said.
sentences.chinese: “我们不能把火车开出车站，”斯诺说。

definition: Hailun county level city in Suihua 綏化|绥化, Heilongjiang/Helen or Hélène (name)
Agnes Smedley (1892-1950), US journalist and activist, reported on China, esp. the communist side
Edgar Snow (1905-1972), American journalist, reported from China 1928-1941, author of Red Star Over China
Clark T. Randt Jr. (1945-), US ambassador to Beijing 2001-2009
